sen.j: 玉露（ぎょくろ）は日本茶の一種。
sen.e: Gyokuro is a kind of Japanese tea.
Gyokuro is a kind of Japanese tea.
Gyokuro is a kind of Japanese tea.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary:
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 製造法上の分類としては煎茶の一種であるが、栽培方法に特徴がある。
sen.e: In terms of manufacturing method, gyokuro is classified as a kind of sencha (green tea,) but its cultivation process is characteristic.
In terms of its manufacturing method, gyokuro is classified as a kind of sencha (green tea), but its cultivation process is characteristic.
In terms of its manufacturing method, gyokuro is classified as a kind of sencha (green tea), but its cultivation process is characteristic.

sen.j: すなわち、玉露の原料となる茶葉は、収穫の前（最低二週間程度）被覆を施される。
sen.e: More specifically, gyokuro tea leaves, the raw materials of gyokuro, are cultivated under a cover for at least two weeks before being harvested.
More specifically, gyokuro tea leaves, the raw materials of gyokuro, are cultivated under a cover for at least two weeks before being harvested.
More specifically, gyokuro tea leaves, the raw materials of gyokuro, are cultivated under a cover for at least two weeks before being harvested.

sen.j: これにより、煎茶の旨味の原因とされるアミノ酸が増加し、逆に渋みの原因とされるカテキン類（いわゆるタンニン）が減少する。
sen.e: This process increases quantity of amino acids which produce a flavor of sencha, and decreases quantity of catechins (so called "tannin") which cause astringency.
This process increases the quantity of amino acids, which result in the flavor of sencha, and decreases the quantity of catechins (so-called "tannin"), which cause astringency.
This process increases the quantity of amino acids, which result in the flavor of sencha, and decreases the quantity of catechins (so-called tannin), which cause astringency.
sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: また、被覆により特徴的な香り（かぶせ香）が生ずる。
sen.e: Through this process, the tea leaves obtain a distinctive aroma (special odor gained from the covering process.)
Through this process, the tea leaves obtain a distinctive aroma (a particular odor gained through the covering process).
Through this process, the tea leaves obtain a distinctive aroma (a particular odor gained through the covering process).

sen.j: このような栽培方法は碾茶と同様であるが、すでに安土桃山時代に行われていたとの記録がある。
sen.e: This kind of cultivation method for gyokuro tea leaves is the same as for tencha (powdered green tea), and reportedly was already practiced in the Azuchi-Momoyama Period.
This kind of cultivation method for gyokuro tea leaves is the same as for tencha (powdered green tea), and reportedly it was already practiced during the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
This kind of cultivation method for gyokuro tea leaves is the same as for tencha (powdered green tea), and reportedly it was already practiced during the Azuchi-Momoyama period.

sen.j: 由来
sen.e: Origin:
Origin
Origin

sen.j: 「玉露」の名前は、製茶業者山本山の商品名に由来。
sen.e: The name "gyokuro" came from the trade name of product sold by a tea manufacturer, Yamamotoyama.
The name "gyokuro" came from the trade name of a product sold by a tea manufacturer, Yamamotoyama.
The name 'gyokuro' came from the trade name of a product sold by a tea manufacturer, Yamamotoyama.

sen.j: 天保6年（1835年）に山本山の六代山本嘉兵衛（徳翁）が、宇治市小倉の木下家において茶葉を露のように丸く焙り、これが「玉露」の原型となった。
sen.e: In 1835, the sixth owner of Yamamotoyama, Kahei YAMAMOTO (Tokuou) roasted tea leaves and rounded them into dew-like shapes at the house of Kinoshita family located in Ogura, Uji City, which later became the original form of "gyokuro" (which literally translates as"jade dews.")

In 1835, the sixth owner of Yamamotoyama, Kahei YAMAMOTO (Tokuou) roasted tea leaves and rounded them into dew-like shapes at the house of the Kinoshita family located in Ogura, Uji City, which later became the original form of "gyokuro" (which literally translates as "jade dew").

In 1835, the sixth owner of Yamamotoyama, Kahei (Tokuo) YAMAMOTO roasted tea leaves and rounded them into dew-like shapes at the house of the Kinoshita family located in Ogura, Uji City, which later became the original form of 'gyokuro' (which literally translates as "jade dew").
sen.cmt: " → ' としました。Kahei (Tokuo) YAMAMOTO としました。

sen.j: 現在は棒状に焙っている。
sen.e: Today, tea leaves are roasted and processed into bar shapes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Today, tea leaves are roasted and processed into bar shapes.
Today, tea leaves are roasted and processed into bar shapes.

sen.j: これは明治初期に製茶業者の辻利右衛門（辻利）によって完成されたものである。
sen.e: This current process was completed by another tea manufacturer, Toshiuemon TSUJI (Tsujitoshi) at the beginning of the Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This current process was completed by another tea manufacturer, Toshiuemon TSUJI (Tsujitoshi) at the beginning of the Meiji period.
This current process was completed by another tea manufacturer, Toshiuemon TSUJI (Tsujitoshi) at the beginning of the Meiji period.

sen.j: 特徴・品種
sen.e: Features and variety:
Features and varieties
Features and varieties

sen.j: 玉露は日本の煎茶として高級のものと考えて良いが、品評会等では一般的な煎茶とは別のものとして扱われる（煎茶の狭義と広義の説明を参照）。
sen.e: Though gyokuro may be categorized as high class sencha produced in Japan, it is treated separately from ordinary sencha in fairs etc. (refer to the above articles of "sencha in the broad sense" and "sencha in the narrow sense")

Though gyokuro may be categorized as a high-class sencha produced in Japan, it is treated separately from ordinary sencha in fairs, etc. (refer to the above articles on "sencha in the broad sense" and "sencha in the narrow sense").

Although gyokuro may be categorized as a high-class sencha produced in Japan, it is treated separately from ordinary sencha in fairs, etc. (refer to the articles on "sencha in the broad sense" and "sencha in the narrow sense").

sen.j: 飲用に際して、玉露の滋味と香気の特徴を活かすには、60℃程度の低温（茶葉によっては40℃前後まで温度を下げる場合もある）の湯で浸出することが重要である。
sen.e: For drinking, it is important to keep temperature of hot water as low as around 60 degrees (or even 40 degrees depending on tea leaves) centigrade in order for distinct flavor and aroma of gyokuro to leach out.

For drinking, it is important to keep the temperature of hot water as low as around 60 degrees (or even 40 degrees, depending on the tea leaves) centigrade in order for the distinct flavor and aroma of gyokuro to leach out.

For drinking, it is important to keep the temperature of hot water as low as around 60 degrees (or even 40 degrees, depending on the tea leaves) centigrade in order for the distinct flavor and aroma of gyokuro to leach out.

sen.j: 玉露はその甘みが特徴であり、高温の湯で淹れると苦味成分まで抽出してしまう。
sen.e: Gyokuro is characterized by its sweetness, but if you brew it in hot water of high temperature, bitter ingredients of tea leaves also leach out.
Gyokuro is characterized by its sweetness, but if you brew it in water at a high temperature, the bitter ingredients of the tea leaves will also leach out.
Gyokuro is characterized by its sweetness, but if you brew it in water at a high temperature, the bitter ingredients of the tea leaves will also leach out.

sen.j: 茶木の品種についても、煎茶をはじめとする日本茶の多くはヤブキタが使用されているが、玉露は、アサヒ、ヤマカイ、オクミドリ、サエミドリなど、個性の強い品種が使われることが多い。
sen.e: As for types of tea plants, while most of sencha and other Japanese teas are from the Yabukita variety, gyokuro is often made from special variety plants with strong characteristics such as Asahi, Yamakai, Okumidori and Saemidori.

As for types of tea plants, while most sencha and other Japanese teas are from the Yabukita variety, gyokuro is often made from special plant varieties with strong characteristics, such as Asahi, Yamakai, Okumidori and Saemidori.

As for types of tea plants, while most sencha and other Japanese teas are from the Yabukita variety, gyokuro is often made from special plant varieties with strong characteristics, such as Asahi, Yamakai, Okumidori and Saemidori.

sen.j: 玉露の呼び名自体に特に規定があるわけではなく、特に茶飲料の「玉露入り」に配合されている茶葉は、棚を作らず化学繊維で茶の木に直接カバーを掛け、かつ被覆日数の浅いかぶせ茶に近い物である場合も多い。
sen.e: While the name of "gyokuro" itself is not specifically defined to any use, there are many cases that tea leaves used in tea beverages named "gyokuro-iri" ("containing gyokuro") in particular are similar to those of kabuse-cha (covered tea) which are not cultivated under trellis like real gyokuro but under a synthetic textile sheet which is put directly on tea plants for fewer days than real gyokuro's case.

While the name "gyokuro" itself isn't specifically defined a pertaining to a particular use, there are many cases in which the tea leaves used in tea beverages called "gyokuro-iri" ("containing gyokuro") are similar to those of kabuse-cha (covered tea), which are not cultivated under trellises like real gyokuro but under a synthetic textile sheet that is put directly on the tea plants for fewer days than in the case of genuine gyokuro.

While the name gyokuro itself isn't specifically defined pertaining to a particular use, there are many cases in which the tea leaves used in tea beverages called 'gyokuro-iri' (containing gyokuro) are similar to those of kabuse-cha (covered tea), which are not cultivated under trellises like real gyokuro but under a synthetic textile sheet that is put directly on the tea plants for fewer days than in the case of genuine gyokuro.

sen.j: 最大の玉露産地は福岡県八女地域である。
sen.e: The greatest production area of gyokuro in Japan is Yame, Fukuoka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「そのため」は訳していません（直訳すると、前文とのつながりが不自然になるため。
sen.e: The chief production area of gyokuro in Japan is Yame, Fukuoka Prefecture.
The chief production area of gyokuro in Japan is Yame, Fukuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: そこでは、茶樹の枝を剪定をせず、芽を自然に伸ばしている。
sen.e: There, twigs of tea plants are not pruned and burgeons are left growing by themselves.
There, the twigs of tea plants aren't pruned and the burgeons are left to grow by themselves.
There, the twigs of tea plants aren't pruned and the burgeons are left to grow by themselves.

sen.j: 稲藁で、茶の木と距離を取った棚から被覆する。
sen.e: Trellises, which are installed with enough height from the top of each tea tree, are covered by rice straws.
Trellises, which are installed with sufficient height from the top of each tea tree, are covered in rice straw.
Trellises, which are installed with sufficient height from the top of each tea tree, are covered in rice straw.

sen.j: しごき摘みで一心二葉を手摘みする。
sen.e: Each burgeon and two nearby young leaves are plucked one by one by squeezing and drawing them through a hand.
Each burgeon and two nearby young leaves are plucked one by one by squeezing and drawing them through a hand.
Each burgeon and two nearby young leaves are plucked one by one by squeezing and drawing them through a hand.

sen.j: 茶葉については、「伝統本玉露」と呼んで区別している。
sen.e: The tea leaves produced as above in Yame area are called "Dento-hon-gyokuro" ("traditional gyokuro for real,") and are treated in distinction from other tea leaves.
The tea leaves produced as above in the Yame area are called "Dento-hon-gyokuro" ("traditional gyokuro for real") and are treated as distinct from other tea leaves.
The tea leaves produced as above in the Yame area are called 'Dento-hon-gyokuro' (traditional gyokuro for real) and are treated as distinct from other tea leaves.

sen.j: 全国茶品評会に出品されている高品質の玉露は、全て伝統本玉露である。
sen.e: Gyokuro of high quality, exhibited at Zenkoku Cha Hinpyokai (literally, "the National Fair of Tea,") are all Dento-hon-gyokuro.
Gyokuro of high quality, exhibited at Zenkoku Cha Hinpyokai (literally, "the National Fair of Tea"), are all Dento-hon-gyokuro.
Gyokuro of high quality, exhibited at Zenkoku Cha Hinpyokai (the National Fair of Tea), are all Dento-hon-gyokuro.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Others:
Others
Others

sen.j: 良く似た商品名として佐賀、長崎、鹿児島等で作られる「玉緑茶（たまりょくちゃ。グリ茶とも）」という物があるが、これは製造工程に「精揉（形をまっすぐに整える）」が存在しない。
sen.e: Similar name to "gyokuro" is "tama-ryokucha"(literally, "spherical green tea") which are produced in Saga, Nagasaki and Kagoshima Prefectures.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A name similar to "gyokuro" is "tama-ryokucha"(literally, "spherical green tea") which is produced in Saga, Nagasaki and Kagoshima prefectures.

A name of a product similar to gyokuro is 'tama-ryokucha' (spherical green tea, also known as guricha) which is produced in Saga, Nagasaki and Kagoshima prefectures, however, its manufacturing process has no 'precise kneading' (straightening).
sen.cmt: 分かれていたセルを一つにまとめ、英文もそれに応じて修正しました。" → ' としました。

sen.j: 茶葉が丸みを帯び、淹れた煎茶の味に渋みが少ない茶葉の事であり、玉露とは関係ない。
sen.e: Its leaves are somehow rounded and taste less bitter when brewed, having nothing to do with gyokuro.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its leaves are somehow rounded and taste less bitter when brewed, having nothing to do with gyokuro.
Its leaves are somehow rounded and taste less bitter when brewed, having nothing to do with gyokuro.
